data.enText: from danger/defeat
to move away from a place or an enemy because you are in danger or because you have been defeated

data.chText: 部队因伤亡惨重被迫撤退。
data.enText: The army was forced to retreat after suffering heavy losses.
We retreated back down the mountain.
move away/back
to move away or back

data.chText: 他看着她的身影渐渐远去。
data.enText: He watched her retreating figure.
The flood waters slowly retreated.
change decision

data.chText: （由于批评或环境过于恶劣）改变主意，退缩
data.enText: to change your mind about sth because of criticism or because a situation has become too difficult

data.chText: 政府已经改变了缩小班级规模的承诺。
data.enText: The government had retreated from its pledge to reduce class sizes.
to quiet place
to escape to a place that is quieter or safer

data.chText: 她厌倦了这样的交谈，躲进了自己的卧室。
data.enText: Bored with the conversation, she retreated to her bedroom.
He retreated into a world of fantasy.
finance
to lose value

data.chText: 这种股票价格下跌45便士，降到了538便士。
data.enText: Share prices retreated 45p to 538p.
from danger/defeat
a movement away from a place or an enemy because of danger or defeat
Hitler's retreat from Russia
The army was in full retreat (= retreating very quickly) .
to sound the retreat (= to give a loud signal for an army to move away)
escape
an act of trying to escape from a particular situation to one that you think is safer or more pleasant

data.chText: 看电视是对现实的一种逃避吗？
data.enText: Is watching television a retreat from reality?
change of decision

data.chText: （由于批评或环境过于恶劣）改变决定，退缩
data.enText: an act of changing a decision because of criticism or because a situation has become too difficult

data.chText: 这位参议员很尴尬地改变了他早先的立场。
data.enText: The Senator made an embarrassing retreat from his earlier position.
quiet place
a quiet, private place that you go to in order to get away from your usual life
a country retreat
a period of time when sb stops their usual activities and goes to a quiet place for prayer and thought; an organized event when people can do this

data.chText: 他去静修并试图调节自己内心的矛盾冲突。
data.enText: He went into retreat and tried to resolve the conflicts within himself.
to go on a Buddhist retreat
beat a (hasty) retreat
to go away or back quickly, especially to avoid sth unpleasant

simple_means.memory_skill: re 回 + treat 处理 → 处理回去 → 退回去 → 退却；隐退

means: (由于批评或环境过于恶劣)改变主意，退缩
(由于批评或环境过于恶劣)改变决定，退缩

ex.chText: 他还不打算从杂志总编辑的位置上退下来。
ex.enText: He has no plans to retire as chief editor of the magazine.

ex.chText: 她65岁从教师岗位上退休。
他躲进自己的房间给她打电话。
ex.enText: He retired to his room to call her.

ex.chText: 他上半场因膝部受伤只得退赛。
ex.enText: He had to retire with a knee injury in the first half.

synonyms.bx: 指退职、退役、退休、因伤退出比赛等；也指离开去某个僻静之处。

ex.chText: 因为洪水泛滥，村民们被全部撤离。
ex.enText: The villagers were evacuated because of flood.

ex.chText: 士兵们全部从前线撤退。
ex.enText: The soldiers were evacuated from the front.

synonyms.bx: 指把人从危险地区疏散、撤空。

ex.chText: 他们错失了进攻时机，只得撤退。
ex.enText: They missed the opportunity to attack and had to retreat.
He retreated when he saw her.

ex.chText: 她别无选择，只能退出公众生活。
ex.enText: She has no choice but to retreat from public life.

ex.chText: 溃败的士兵只得撤出战斗。
ex.enText: The defeated soldiers had to retreat from the battle.

ex.chText: 拿破仑的部队只得从莫斯科撤退。
ex.enText: Napoleon's troops had to retreat from Moscow.

synonyms.bx: 多指因处境危险或被打败而退却，尤指军队撤退，也指避开某人或某物，或从一个地方移到另一个安静的私人场所，常含被迫、不情愿之意。

ex.enText: The commander refused to withdraw his troops.
The peacekeeping forces were forced to withdraw.

ex.chText: 重感冒迫使她退出了游泳比赛。
ex.enText: A bad cold forced him to withdraw from the swimming competition.

ex.chText: 公众对该国政府的决定提出抗议，反对退出欧盟。
ex.enText: The public protested against the country's decision to withdraw from the European Union.

synonyms.bx: 指让部队等撤离某处，或指某人退出活动、组织等，侧重因某种原因而有意或被迫撤退、离开。

data.enText: beat a (hasty) retreat
to go away or back quickly, especially to avoid sth unpleasant

tr: the act of withdrawing or going backward (especially to escape something hazardous or unpleasant)
withdrawal for prayer and study and meditation
example: the religious retreat is a form of vacation activity

tr: (military) withdrawal of troops to a more favorable position to escape the enemy's superior forces or after a defeat
example: the disorderly retreat of French troops

tr: an area where you can be alone
(military) a bugle call signaling the lowering of the flag at sunset
(military) a signal to begin a withdrawal from a dangerous position
a place affording peace and quiet
make a retreat from an earlier commitment or activity
example: We'll have to crawfish out from meeting with him
He backed out of his earlier promise
The aggressive investment company pulled in its horns

tr: pull back or move away or backward
example: The limo pulled away from the curb
The Pope retreats to Castelgondolfo every summer

value.def: If you retreat, you move away from something or someone.

example.ex: 'I've already got a job,' I said quickly, and retreated from the room...
example.tran: “我已经有了一份工作。”我马上说道，并从房间里退了出来。

example.ex: The young nurse pulled a face at the Matron's retreating figure.
example.tran: 看着护士长离去的身影，这个年轻的护士做了个鬼脸。

value.def: When an army retreats, it moves away from enemy forces in order to avoid fighting them.

example.ex: The French, suddenly outnumbered, were forced to retreat...
example.tran: 人数突然处于劣势的法军被迫撤退。

example.ex: Retreating soldiers were dousing homes and shops with petrol and setting them on fire.
example.tran: 撤退的士兵把汽油浇到住宅和商店上，并放火焚烧。

example.ex: In June 1942, the British 8th Army was in full retreat.

value.def: If you retreat from something such as a plan or a way of life, you give it up, usually in order to do something safer or less extreme.

example.ex: I believe people should live in houses that allow them to retreat from the harsh realities of life...
example.tran: 我认为人们所居住的房子应该能让他们远离残酷的现实生活。

example.ex: From bouncing confidence she had retreated into self-pity.
example.tran: 她从信心百倍变得自怜自哀。

example.ex: The President's remarks appear to signal that there will be no retreat from his position...
example.tran: 总统的言辞似乎在暗示他不会主动辞职。

example.ex: It's a retreat into the adolescence they never really had.
example.tran: 这是对他们从不曾真正拥有的青春时代的回归。

value.tran: 放弃，远离（计划、生活方式等）；从…中隐退

value.def: A retreat is a quiet, isolated place that you go to in order to rest or to do things in private.

example.ex: He spent yesterday hidden away in his country retreat.
example.tran: 他昨天躲在了他乡下的静养地。

value.def: If you beat a retreat, you leave a place quickly in order to avoid an embarrassing or dangerous situation.

example.ex: Cockburn decided it was time to beat a hasty retreat.
example.tran: 科伯恩认为到了该紧急撤退的时候了。

partsOfSpeech.dec: en 使… + treat 处理 → 使…得到处理 → 恳求
entreat 恳求 + y 表结果 → 恳求，请求
mal 坏 + treat 处理 → 虐待
re 回 + treat 处理 → 处理回去 → 退回去 → 退却；隐退
treat 处理 + ment 表名词 → 待遇；治疗
treat 处理 + y 表名词 → 处理〔纷争的文件〕→ 条约
